image.altText: Peter Dutton yelling in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader fiercely condemned the prime minister for using the motion for personal political gain and accused him of "talking out of both sides of his mouth".

title.children: Coalition refuses to support motion marking the first anniversary of the October 7 attacks

image.altText: Assala Sayara speaks at Pro-Palestine rally.

props.synopsis: Protesters have gathered outside Federal Parliament to demand Australia sanction Israel for its actions in Gaza and Lebanon, a day after commemorations a year on from the Hamas terrorist attack on southern Israel.

title.children: 'We come with rage': Pro-Palestine protesters say ongoing conflict taking emotional toll on local community

image.altText: a woman wearing a face mask walking in front of street art

props.synopsis: Australia has recorded its first cases of the XEC COVID-19 variant that has been spreading in Europe this year. Here's what you need to know about XEC — the highly transmissible strain that has been reported in 29 countries.

title.children: A highly transmissible COVID-19 variant has arrived in Australia. What you need to know about XEC

image.altText: A sign reading "Toretsk" painted in blue and yellow next to a small tower on a small hill.

props.synopsis: Russia, which now controls just under a fifth of Ukrainian territory, has been advancing towards Toretsk since August.

title.children: Russian forces advance on Ukraine frontline city after Crimea oil depot attack

image.altText: A woman's hands hold a smartphone in shadow.

props.synopsis: Australia's tech laws are outdated, experts say, but mandating platforms like X or Facebook to prevent harm in the first place could avoid hate speech and disinformation entirely.

title.children: How Brazil managed to bring X in line — and why an Australian duty of care could do the same

image.altText: Timelapse of a sky from twilight to night, with antennas scattered across the landscape.

props.synopsis: If there are aliens out there, we'll find them. That's the message from the team behind one of the world's biggest science projects being built in remote Australia.

title.children: 'Leakage from electronics': A giant telescope in the Aussie outback could answer one of humanity's biggest questions

image.altText: A man pointing at a screen. There are students behind him.

props.synopsis: Swinburne University's Matthew Bailes has been recognised for his role in discovering fast radio bursts, which are now used by scientists to learn about the Universe.

title.children: Astrophysicist wins 2024 PM's Prize for Science for fast radio burst discovery

image.altText: Hurricane Milton

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of residents in Florida's Tampa region are bracing for the second major hurricane in weeks, Milton set to make landfall as a category five storm on Wednesday.

title.children: What to know about 'explosively' intensifying Hurricane Milton as it speeds toward Florida

image.altText: A man wearing a light blue collared shirt and yellow tie sits at a wooden desk in front of a navy curtain against a white wall.

props.synopsis: Deputy governor Andrew Hauser says the RBA will keep having off-the-record briefings with private banks, despite some attendees leaking details of conversation.

title.children: RBA deputy governor defends private briefings with banks, says oil price isn't a 'top-three risk' right now

image.altText: A navy blue sign with the words Nobel Prize in Physics 2024.

props.synopsis: The scientists won the award for their discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning within artificial neural networks.

title.children: Scientists win Nobel Prize in Physics for developing methods that are 'the foundation' of AI

image.altText: The Israeli flag hanging from the frame of a house.

props.synopsis: One year ago, Hamas militants infiltrated Be'eri kibbutz. It was one of many coordinated attacks across Israel that began the Israel-Hamas war — and a delayed response by the Israeli defence force has been blamed for some of the 101 deaths, and dozens taken hostage.

title.children: Heroism, heartbreak and hundreds dead: Inside the Be'eri massacre

image.altText: An SES worker removing debris from the cyclone.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology and emergency services say preparations remain urgent, with an "average" season meaning five cyclones are likely to cross the coast.

title.children: BOM says cyclones could grow in intensity despite 'average' season forecast

image.altText: Apollo Quiboloy speaks behind a desk with his right hand in the air during a press conference

props.synopsis: Apollo Quiboloy is currently detained in the Philippines facing serious domestic charges and is the subject of an ongoing investigation, but that hasn't stopped him registering for the poll.

title.children: Pastor wanted by the FBI for sex trafficking registers for Philippine senate elections

image.altText: robbie katter speaking to media

props.synopsis: Katter's Australian Party says it will aim to wind back Queensland abortion laws "quick as you like" with a repeal bill.

title.children: Katter's Australian Party says it will try to repeal Queensland's abortion laws

image.altText: a smiling woman

props.synopsis: Stephanie Ryan and eight-year-old Raven died in a townhouse fire east of Brisbane on Sunday.

title.children: Babysitter killed in townhouse fire remembered for her willingness to help others

image.altText: Rows of milk cartons lined up in a shop fridge

props.synopsis: There is currently no law requiring grocery stores to display visible pricing on their shelves, creating a legal loophole that leaves some shoppers "flying blind" when it comes to the weekly shop.

title.children: 'There would be outrage': Shoppers confused and frustrated by shops with no prices

image.altText: A truck bogged in muddy red dirt.

props.synopsis: A remote West Australian community fears truck drivers will stop bringing supplies unless urgent upgrades are made to its "rough as guts" delivery route.

title.children: This outback road bogged five vehicles in a day and could soon leave a community stranded

image.altText: Madeleine McCann

props.synopsis: In the trial in Brunswick, Brueckner faced three charges of aggravated rape and two of sexual abuse of children committed between 2000 and 2017.

title.children: Madeleine McCann suspect Christian Brueckner acquitted of unrelated sexual crimes

image.altText: A boulder on black.

props.synopsis: The European Space Agency's Hera will travel to the scene of the crash and investigate whether the asteroid has a new crater or new shape and whether it has begun to tumble.

title.children: NASA rammed an asteroid to see if they could change its course. It worked — but now they want to see the damage

image.altText: A woman with a blonde ponytail in in side profile with a man behind her outside a court building.

props.synopsis: Three men admit kidnapping and torturing a 68-year-old Chinese national during an ordeal lasting more than two days after luring him to Australia with the promise of a business deal.

title.children: Trio used electric shock collar, pliers to torture kidnapped Chinese man during 50-hour extortion ordeal, court hears

image.altText: Milk bottles in a supermarket fridge with a red 'Lower Shelf Price' sign in the window

props.synopsis: Coles and Woolworths say they’re passing milk price reductions on to shoppers. But what do shelf price cuts mean for the farmers who produce the milk?

title.children: Supermarkets drop milk price to lowest since 2010 as farmers fear return of 'milk war'

image.altText: Sam Konstas of New South Wales celebrates his century by raising his bat and removing his helmet

props.synopsis: Teenage prodigy Sam Konstas has announced himself on the big stage, striking a coming-of-age century for NSW.

title.children: Teen prodigy scores first Sheffield Shield century as battle for Australian opener intensifies

image.altText: A glass office building exterior reflects other buildings.

props.synopsis: "They got away with it" is a common refrain after corporate scandals that end without consequences for individuals. A landmark High Court ruling could radically reshape that.

title.children: The court decision sending a chill through board rooms and executive suites

image.altText: Christos Tsiolkas crosses his arms and stands at a pool in front of signage declaring "deep water".

props.synopsis: Christos Tsiolkas is one of Australia's most celebrated authors, but as a young man he nearly left the country after experiencing 'absolute euphoria' overseas.

title.children: 'I was wrong': The piece of writing that author Christos Tsiolkas regrets to this day

image.altText: A multi-storey office building behind a fence.

props.synopsis: The heads of the NT's peak legal bodies have expressed their "collective grave concern" at the impact of Legal Aid's impending service cuts, in a letter sent to the NT Attorney-General.

title.children: Powerful legal bodies warn Legal Aid NT service cuts will cause 'chaos and uncertainty'

image.altText: A ute with a toolbox drives down a mainstreet surrounded by businesses.

props.synopsis: The 19-year-old Mansfield apprentice was inside the toolbox for more than 20 minutes while his director drove between jobs. The apprentice recorded a video commenting on the heat and his discomfort.

title.children: Plumber fined $20,000 after putting young apprentice in ute toolbox

image.altText: Man sitting at board room table speaking to politicians

props.synopsis: The delivery of two new Spirit of Tasmania vessels has faced significant scrutiny over its repeated delays and cost blowouts. The former chair of the ferry operator has now taken aim at the government over its "appalling" support

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania saga escalates with claims of safety risks, 'appalling' support and strained relationships

image.altText: The Weeknd peforms live at Melborune's Marvel Stadium, Saturday 5 October, 2024

props.synopsis: The Canadian artist has been reigning pop royalty for more than a decade. Now Spotify's #1 most streamed artist proves good things come to those who wait with his long-awaited Australian tour.

title.children: The Weeknd finally makes it back to Australia — was it worth the wait?

image.altText: Picture of dam wall in Toowoomba region.

props.synopsis: Dozens of dams need to be upgraded across Queensland at a cost of more than $3 billion, prompting calls for the next state government to offer financial support.

title.children: Council reeling at $40m order to protect seven people from rare weather event

image.altText: An older Lebanese man wearing a white turban and beard stares intensely

props.synopsis: The deputy chief's remarks were made in a televised address.

title.children: Hezbollah deputy chief says the militant group supports Lebanese efforts for a ceasefire with Israel

image.altText: A medium shot of a court house

props.synopsis: A 28-year-old man intended to destroy an ex-services club and burn some of the people inside when he allegedly poured fuel over two people in a small central New South Wales town, a court has been told.

title.children: Man doused bartender and pub patron in petrol during 'malicious' attack, court hears

image.altText: Marley Wright-Martin wears a grey t-shirt and smiles at the camera in front of some bushes.

props.synopsis: Marley Wright-Martin, 27, was being held in solitary confinement at Port Phillip Prison when he died in September. His family has given permission for his name and image to be used.

title.children: 'We should all be outraged': Family of Aboriginal man who died in custody calls for answers

image.altText: A man wearing a navy blue t-shirt and sunglasses speaks at a podium.

props.synopsis: US citizen Khaled Beydoun was a guest speaker at an October 7 rally held outside Lakemba mosque on Monday. Several hundred people gathered at the rally, where speakers criticised politicians for their stance.

title.children: US speaker's visa under review after saying October 7 a 'celebration' at pro-Palestinian rally

image.altText: a close up detailed shot of a pink flower

props.synopsis: The endangered Beadle's grevillea only grows in a few areas in the wild. After a harsh drought, the species is now thriving and the couple that saved it wants the plant safeguarded for generations to come.

title.children: Rare grevillea in full bloom after couple nurses plants through drought
